reviews.title: Fine for lunch
reviews.text: The sandwiches were excellent in quality. So much variety and very beautiful presentation. Tasty! I recommend this address.

articleContent.title: Your go-to guide for dog-friendly travel

seoInfo.metaDescription: Traveling with your dog has never been easier—or more fun. Cities across the country boast pet-friendly hotels, parks, and activities. With CESAR® brand’s mission to make the world more pet-friendly and Tripadvisor’s top-rated spots, you can plan with confidence. Whether it’s a quick getaway or a bucket-list trip, our guides help you stay, play, and explore with your pup. Grab the leash and go!

articleContent.title: Find your cultural wonder in Türkiye

seoInfo.metaDescription: With a staggeringly rich heritage that spans centuries, religions and regions, Türkiye stands apart for the sheer wealth of its cultural treasures—making it easy to ‘see the sights’ your way, in this impressively diverse land.

It used to be that travelers considered Athens—one of the world’s oldest cities—just a jumping-off spot for the Greek islands. Maybe you squeezed in a quick tour of the Acropolis, but then you caught that flight or ferry heading to Santorini or Mykonos. Now, thanks to growing culture, design, and food scenes, people are finally staying a bit longer and appreciating more of what this historic world capital has to offer.

randomContentList.sponsorDisplayName: Fort Myers – Islands, Beaches and Neighborhoods

tripContent.title: Experience vibrant art and culture in Fort Myers
tripContent.description: There’s so much more to soak up than the sun in and around Fort Myers. This itinerary is designed for art-lovers, who can take in the visual and performing arts scene, learn about the area’s fascinating history, and go for a scenic stroll to enjoy neighborhood murals and outdoor art installations.

articleContent.title: A perfect day in New York City

seoInfo.metaDescription: Osaka isn’t the first place most people think of when they plan a trip to Japan, but once you visit you’ll know why frequent visitors—me included—fall in love with it. Here you’ll find a nostalgic version of Japan where time seems to have stopped back when glowing neon signs and extravagantly lighted billboards were all the rage. If you love Japanese food, Osaka will be an easy favorite—there’s a reason it’s known as Japan’s kitchen. Osaka fans like me come here just to eat. But pace yourself, getting overstuffed is a common rookie mistake.

articleContent.title: 9 amazing waterfall hikes in New York, from Westchester to the Adirondacks

seoInfo.metaDescription: Niagara may get all the attention, but it's hardly the only waterfall worth visiting. These waterfall hikes in New York take you to the highlights.
It’s a privilege to visit the world’s most beautiful oceans. Celebrate World Oceans Day by learning how to protect them.

randomContentList.sponsorDisplayName: the More to Jamaica Community-Based Tourism Project

seoInfo.metaDescription: Experience Jamaica through local eyes. From Maroon traditions and family-run farms to artisan workshops and river tubing adventures, these are the moments that bring the island’s soul to life. Across the island, communities are opening their doors and inviting you in. Travel deeper with locally-led experiences and see a side of Jamaica some visitors miss: authentic, unforgettable, and full of heart.
Discover the past and present of one of America’s most famous Black business districts.

author.name: Malika Freydberg for TravelCoterie in partnership with Tripadvisor

seoInfo.metaDescription: When you picture San Francisco, chances are you're visualizing the iconic Golden Gate Bridge. Well, don't worry, this itinerary definitely gets you to that bridge to take in those astounding views. But with five days, you'll also have plenty of time to comfortably fit in loads of other must-sees, like the sea lions at Fisherman’s Wharf and the drama of Alcatraz Island. And I’ve built in breaks for sipping California wine, downing dim sum, and riding cable cars, too.
